metadata.title: CVE-2017-16663 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In sam2p 0.49.4, there are integer overflows (with resultant heap-basedbuffer overflows) in input-bmp.ci in the function ReadImage, because "width* height" multiplications occur unsafely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sam2p - 0.49.2-3+deb8u3build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sam2p package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.49.2-3+deb8u3build0.14.04.1').
